messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 1229
messages.msgSnippet: WOW! That is a lot but she been out in the world since 96. Not quite like this. LOL! I m sure she s happy with it or she wouldn t be where she is. From the
messages.messageBody:
WOW! That is a lot but she been out in the world since '96. Not quite
like this. LOL! I'm sure she's happy with it or she wouldn't be where she
is. From the glimpses that you gave she knew her own mind and went with her
heart. I wish her the best and brightest.:-)

Scary I know! We have been school free since '96 too. My oldest,
Michael, is 18. He started Community College in Sept '03 fulltime. Got his
drivers license in Jan '04. He took a seasonal job for Christmas and
Valentines day. Now he's taking a break from school and enjoying his
friends. Most of them are Seniors this year. He is currently battling
depression and the road has been hard for him but I think it's getting
better. I'm so thankful we found this lifestyle. This would have been a
total nightmare if we hadn't. He keep thing to himself enough as it is.
Luckily he does talk to me. His Dad's another story. Well that's quite
enough from me. Glad to see you here. :-)


Barb E
"Do not look back on happiness or dream of it in the future.
You are only sure of today; do not let yourself be cheated out of it."

-- Henry Ward Beecher, US abolitionist & clergyman




on 4/3/04 7:52 AM, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com at
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com wrote:

>
> Hey Barb!! Another familiar face here!
>
> Yup, Kat's life has changed so drastically in the last year. She got her
> license Jan of 2003, first job April 2003, engaged in May 2003, moved out
> and in with her fiance July 2003, and then tied the knot at a civil
> ceremony two weeks ago. <sigh> She was ready, but her dad and I were
> not. What is it with these kids? You raise them to think for themselves,
> make their own decisions, and then they really go out into the world and do
> just that!!! Scary!! LOL!
>
>
> Karen M. Gibson
